alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 2:06AM PST until March 10 at 7:45AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno, Kings, Madera and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 500 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. In addition, Highway 198 is closed from just west of Coalinga at Firestone Ave to the Fresno-Monterey County line due to slide removal, per Caltrans. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Clovis, Hanford, Lemoore, Reedley, Selma, Dinuba, Avenal, Parlier, Coalinga, Kingsburg, Lanare, Stratford, Raisin City, Armona, Bowles, Easton, Home Garden, Calwa and Del Rey. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
